STR.REQ: The MapComponent shall support different types of map layers e g terrain satellite
The MissionPlanner shall execute flight plans for multiple UAVs concurrently
The GCS shall transmit the UAV s current location to the GCSMiddleware
The GCS shall report newly connected UAVs to the GCSMiddleware
The GCS shall assign a message frequency for all UAVs
When the connection to the GCS from the GCSMiddleware is lost the GCSMiddleware shall notify Dronology and deactivate all associated UAVs
The GCSMiddleware shall forward commands sent from Dronology to a GCS
The GCSMiddleware shall handle state messages monitoring messages and mode change messages received from an GCS
The GCSMiddleware shall follow a predefined set of steps to establish a connection between a GCS and Dronology
The DronologyRuntimeMonitor shall be able to receive messages from any Dronology component
When a new monitoring message is received the DronologyRuntimeMonitor shall forward the message to all subscribed clients
The DronologyRuntimeMonitor shall provide functionality to retrieve monitoring messages and distribute them to clients
The RealTimeFlightUI shall allow users to follow one or multiple UAVs on the map
The RealTimeFlightUI shall allow users to perform emergency operations e g hovering multiple UAVs sending multiple UAVs to home to a group of UAVs
The RealTimeFlightUI shall allow users to apply flight operations to one or more selected UAVs
The RealTimeFlightUI shall display all currently active flight plans on the map
The RealTimeFlightUI shall display the name and status of all currently activated UAVs
When the RouteCreationUI is loaded a list of all existing routes shall be displayed
The RouteCreationUI shall allow a user to delete a route
The RouteCreationUI shall allow the user to create and modify a route
When requested the RouteCreationUI shall send a newly created or modified route to dronology
The RouteCreationUI shall only accept valid altitude and speed values for waypoint
When a user shall cancels a pending flight plan the RouteAssignmentUI shall notify Dronology
A user may reorder routes or remove flight plans assigned to a UAV as long as the flight has not started execution
When requested by the user the RouteAssignmentUI shall display details about the selected UAV and its flight plans
When a route is assigned or removed from a UAV the RouteAssignmentUI shall notify Dronology
The RouteAssignmentUI shall provide means to select an existing routes and assign them to a UAV
When the VaadinUI is activated the VaadinUI shall be configured according to stored configuration parameters
The UIMiddleware shall accept and activate a mission plan upon request
The UIMiddleware accepts commands from UIs and forwards to Dronology
The UIMiddleware shall provide a list of all existing routes
The UIMiddleware shall provide a list of all active UAVs
The ActivityLogger shall log all commands sent to and messages received from a CGS
The ActivityLogger shall log all flight plan related events
The InternalSimulator shall approximate the state of the battery
When given a landing command the InternalSimulator shall move the UAV from to the ground altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude
When given a takeoff command the InternalSimulator shall move the UAV to the takeoff altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude
The InternalSimulator shall approximate the behavior of a UAV
The UAVRegistrationManager shall store UAV meta data information such as the UAV s technical characteristics
When a UAV is deactivated the UAVActivationManager shall cancel all current and scheduled flight plans
The VehicleCore shall support virtual UAVs
The VehicleCore shall support UAVs connected via the GCS
A flight pattern shall document the longitude latitude and altitude of waypoints in a flight route as offsets from the starting position of the UAV
If requested the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall abort the currently executing flight plan of an UAV
If a UAV does not have any pending flight plans then when it reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall notify the UAV to hover in place
If a route contains a specific UAV ID the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall assign the route to the given UAV
When requested the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall schedule a route for execution
When requested if a mission is currently active the MissionPlanner shall cancel the active mission
The MissionPlanner shall manage predefined FlightPatterns
When a flight plan is activated for a UAV currently on the ground the FlightSchedulingandExecution shall notify the UAV to takeoff vertically until it reaches the prescribed altitude
If a flight plan is active and the hover in place command is rescinded the FlightManager shall notify the UAV to continue to the originally designated waypoint
If a flight route is assigned to a UAV which is currently hovering in place the FlightManager shall assign the route and maintain the hover in place mode
When the hover in place command is issued the FlightManager shall halt the UAV in place and maintain its current position
When given two coordinates the CoordinateSystem shall compute the direction from the first coordinate to the second coordinate
When given two coordinates the CoordinateSystem shall compute the distance between them
When requested the CoordinateSystem shall transform coordinates to alternate formats
The FlightRouteManager shall persist flight routes
The FlightRouteManager shall ensure that all flight routes represent a VALID FLIGHT ROUTE

The FlightRouteManager shall define flight routes as an ordered sequence of waypoints in which the first waypoint represents the first target location and the final waypoint represents the final target location
When the return to home command is issued the FlightManager shall return the UAV to its original launch location without issuing any additional waypoint or routing commands
When the GCS loses the connection to an UAV the GCS shall attempt to reconnect
The UAVActivationManager shall only activate UAVs that are registered
When a GCS requests activation of a newly detected UAV the GCSMiddleware shall forward the request to Dronology
When a UAV has an active onboard Obstacle Avoidance then the ObstacleAvoidance system shall not issue directives
When a stationary or moving object is within the proximity of a UAV the ObjectAvoidance system shall issue evasive directives to the UAV
The RealTimeFlightUI shall display the location of active UAVs as icons on the map
If a command is issued by the VaadinUI for an UAV the VaadinUI shall request control of that UAV
The UIMiddleware shall provide an interface for registering UI clients
When a UAV s current flight is cancelled the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall in turn cancel all scheduled flight plans for that UAV
If a UAV has pending flight plans then when it reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall execute the next assigned flight plan
If requested the SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall unassign the flight plan assigned to a UAV that is awaiting execution
The SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall maintain a managed list of pending flight plans for Each UAV
When a flight plan is executed the VehicleCore shall send the next waypoint to the UAV
Each waypoint shall be specified using coordinates that include longitude latitude and altitude
The VehicleCore shall associate a UAV TYPE for each UAV defining its basic attributes
The UAVActivationManager shall ensure that only one instance of each registered drone is active at any time
The SingleUAVFlightPlanScheduler shall only execute one flight plan at a time for each UAV
The VehicleCore shall assign a unique ID to each activated UAV
If a client registers for notifications the UIMiddleware shall send notifications for specific events
Each movement command shall specify one of the following command types SET MONITORING FREQUENCY SET STATE FREQUENCY
The RouteCreationUI shall provide capabilities to modify existing routes
Provides map functionality for displaying routes and UAVs leveraging off the shelf map providers such as OSM and google maps
The UIMiddleware accepts resend waypoint commands associated with a unique UAV ID and forwards to Dronology
UAV State messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain the UAV ID and the MODE
If a user attempts to create a route without providing a name then the system shall not save the route
The display of active flight plans shall include time in flight traveled distance remaining distance completed and total waypoints
The properties that the GCS sends to the GCSMiddleware shall be defined in JSON
The GCS shall send the UAV s current properties to the GCSMiddleware when they are received from the UAV
The GCS requests the UAV s properties every UAV MESSAGE MONITORING FREQUENCY seconds
The GCS requests the UAV s current coordinates every UAV MESSAGE STATE FREQUENCY seconds
After UAV RECONNECT TIMEOUT has been reached if connection to the UAV can not be reestablished the GCS shall send a UAV Timeout message containing the UAV ID to the GCSMiddleware
If the connection to an UAV is lost and the GCS fails to reconnect the GCS shall notify the GCSMiddleware
If the GCS receives notification that the UAV is incorrectly registered then the GCS closes the connection with the UAV
The GCS shall send the home location a time stamp and the UAV ID to the GCSMiddleware
When the GCS receives a set frequency command from the GCSMiddleware it shall adjust its messange frequency accordingly
Message frequency shall be defined in units of seconds
The default message frequency for UAV state messages shall be UAV MESSAGE STATE FREQUENCY
The GCS shall transform commands into a vehicle specific format
When a socket error or time out occurs all UAVs associated with the GCS shall be deactivated
The TAKEOFF command shall specify the target altitude
The SET VELOCITY shall specify a velocity vector specified using NED North East Down directions
The SET GROUNDSPEED command shall specify ground speed in meters per second
The GOTO WAYPOINT command shall include a target latitude longitude and altitude coordinate
Each movement command shall specify one of the following command types GOTO WAYPOINT SET GROUNDSPEED SET VELOCITY TAKEOFF LAND HOVER
Each command shall include a unique UAV ID
The GCSMiddleware shall be able to handle and send a setStateFrequency command to the respective GCS containing the desired Frequency in ms
The GCSMiddleware shall be able to handle and send a setMonitoringFrequency command to the respective GCS containing the desired Frequency in ms
UAV State messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain both mandatory and optional elements
UAV Monitoring messages shall be formatted as JSON objects and contain arbitrary information regarding a single UAV
When the activation request is denied the GCSMiddleware shall send a predefined activation denied message to the GCS
When the activation request is approved the GCSMiddleware shall send a predefined activation confirmation message to the GCS
The GCSMiddleware shall call the UAVActivationManager to request UAV activation
In step three the GCS announces its current set of recognized UAVs to the GCSMiddleware
In step two the GCSMiddleware accepts the connection and sends a handshake message
Each GCS connecting to the GCSMiddleware shall be identified through a unique GROUNDSTATION ID
The GCSMiddleware shall only accept one connection for each GCS
The GCSMiddleware shall accept connections with multiple GCS
The GCSMiddleware shall specify a predefined GCS PORT where GCS can connect
A monitoring message shall contain a hierarchical identifier describing the topic a message type a timestamp and arbitrary serializeable data attached to the message
Topics shall be organized in a hierarchical manner meaning that clients can subscribe to all messages messages from certain GCS UAVS and properties
When the UAV s battery level drops below a predefined threshold then the UAV health indicator is activated
When UI follow mode is active the map should continually zoom and pan so that all selected UAVs are centered and their active routes constitutes of the view
When UI follow mode is initiated the map shall automatically zoom and pan so that all selected UAVs are centered and their active routes constitutes of the view
Operations shall include RTL takeoff hover in place and resend command
The UI shall differentiate between completed current and not yet traversed flight segments
The UI shall periodically request current locations of all registered UAVs from the UIMiddleware and update their locations on the map
For each activated UAV the UI shall display information about that UAV i e longitude latitude altitude groud speed battery level etc
Different types of UAVs shall have different icons
When the map is loaded and the all active UAVs list is obtained the UIRealTimeFlightView shall display an icon on the map for each registered UAV based on its current location
When the RealTimeFlightUI is loaded a map shall be displayed with the default zoom level and center coordinates specified in a configuration file
The UI shall periodically request the list of all activated UAVs from the UIMiddleware and updates the display of currently activated UAVs
Upon loading the UI shall request information about all activated UAVs from the UIMiddleware Once the UIMiddleware respond to the request the UI shall display a list of all currently activated UAVs
When the user presses the route delete button a confirmation message shall be displayed and if confirmed by the user then the route shall be deleted
Consecutive waypoints in a route on a map shall be connected by lines
The RouteCreationUI shall support route creation and modification in tabular mode by displaying a editable table showing each waypoint and the velocity of the UAV approaching the waypoint
The route information shall be represented using the Standard Route XML format and transmitted to the UIMiddleware
The UI shall provide respective fields for displaying and modifying the ID textual description waypoints and other route information
The altitude and speed values shall not exceed the current maximum UAV MAX ALTITUDE UAV MAX GROUND SPEED set in the system
Waypoint colors shall be updated as the flight route is edited e g when a new first or last waypoint is added If current edits are canceled the colors shall be reset to reflect current waypoints
When the user presses the cancel pending flight plan button a request is sent to the UI Middleware to cancel the flight
Flight plans assigned to an UAV that have not yet been executed may be deleted by selecting the route and clicking the deselect button
Flight plans assigned to an UAV that have not yet been executed may be reordered by dragging a route within the list of assigned routes to a new position
When detailed information is requested by the user for a UAV the UI shall request the UAV Data object from the UIMiddleware
A route shall be assigned to a selected UAV using the mouse to drag and drop or double clicking on the route
The user shall select a UAV and then assign routes to it from an available route list
Provides capabilities for selecting existing routes and assigning them to active UAVs
Before issuing commands to an UAV the VaadinUI shall request control via the UIMiddleware
User interface for managing UAVs routes and planning flights
The UIMiddleware shall forward a mission plan request to dronology
The UIMiddleware shall assign the list of waypoints from a route to an active UAV in order to create a flight plan
The UIMiddleware accepts hover in place commands associated with a unique UAV ID and forwards to Dronology
The UIMiddleware retrieves and returns a list of previously saved flight routes
The UIMiddleware returns a list of UAV proxy objects containing information about all active UAVs including location battery level ground speed and health status
If the heartbeat fails for a client holding one or more control locks after CLIENT HEARTBEAT TIME then the UIMiddleware shall release all of its control locks
The UIMiddleware shall monitor liveness of clients holding control locks on individual UAVs
The UI middleware shall forward control requests from UI clients to release a control lock on a UAV
The UIMiddleware shall forward control requests from UI clients to hold a control lock on a UAV
A client shall register to the UIMiddleware using a unique id
Provides capabilities for connecting to multiple GCS sending commands to and receiving messages from UAVs
While the log level HW TRACE is active each state and monitoring message shall be logged
Each command sent to a GCS via the GCS Middleware shall be logged

The timestamp and the type of action shall be logged into the mission log for each flight plan related event This includes time of scheduling time of execution time of completing plan reordering plan canceling plan

When a UAV reaches a waypoint while executing a flight plan a log event shall be created that includes the coordinates of the waypoint the UAV the flight plan is assigned to the flight plan ID and the timestamp
When a flight plan is executed a log event shall be created that includes the name of the route the UAV it is assigned to and the execution time stamp
When a flight plan is initiated a log event shall be created that includes the name of the route the UAV it is assigned to and the initiation time stamp
Provides capabilities for logging UAV related events such as assigned flights executed missions
When given a land command the NVECSimulator shall immediately change the UAV s current altitude to the ground altitude

When given a goto command the NVECSimulator shall compute the next coordinate based upon the normal vector and altitude of the current position and the normal vector and altitude of the destination The simulator shall move the UAV with infinite acceleration and use numerical methods to hone in on the next coordinate which will be SIMULATION STEP SIZE meters from the current position along the travel path
When given a takeoff command the NVECSimulator shall move with infinite acceleration the UAV to the takeoff altitude corresponding to its current longitude and latitude
When given a land command the InternalSimulator shall immediately change the UAV s current altitude to the ground altitude
When given a goto command the InternalSimulator shall compute the next coordinate based upon the angle of travel and the step size
Provides basic capabilities for simulating the flight of Virtual UAVs
Provides capabilities for registering UAVs i e providing meta data regarding the UAV such as payload wingspan equipment
The maximum number of activated UAVS shall be defined as MAX UAV
When a UAV is deactivated all scheduled flight plans shall be removed from the UAV s flightplan pool
If the presented UAV ID represents a currently registered UAV then the UAVActivationManager shall activate the UAV
When receiving a new activation request from the GCS Middleware the UAVActivationManager shall check that the presented UAV ID represents a currently registered and non activated UAV
If the presented UAV ID represents a currently activated UAV then the GCS Middleware will be notified and no additional activation will be performed
Provides capabilities for activating and deactivating both Virtual and Physical UAVs within Dronology
When a UAV is in IN AIR state and receives a command to land it transitions to LANDING state
When a UAV is IN AIR state and is assigned a flight plan to execute it transitions to FLYING
The system shall support internally simulated UAVs
An internally simulated UAV is instantiated with an ID that is unique from the IDs of all other currently activated UAVs
An activation request for a UAV that is received from the GCS Middleware is only accepted if the UAV provides an ID unique from all other currently activated UAVs
Each Virtual and Physical drone is associated with a predefined UAV TYPE defining its basic attributes
Core component for managing different types of UAVs
If an obstacle is detected within a distance of MIN STOPPING DISTANCE the ObjectAvoidance system shall issue a hover in place command
The ObjectAvoidance system shall compute pair wise distances between UAVs
The ObjectAvoidance system shall maintain a list of UAV states
The ObjectAvoidance system shall retrieve the state of the UAVs onboard ObjectAvoidance status
The ObjectAvoidance system shall retrieve UAV properties and shall check all directives against them
When the flight plan is aborted the UAV switches to hover in place mode
When the flight plan is aborted it shall be removed from the associated UAV
Each UAV can only store one currently executing flight plan ID

If the flight plan queue is not empty when the UAV reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan then the next flight plan is removed from the queue and set as the currently executed flight plan
When a UAV is issued a return to home command during a flight then the current flight plan is aborted and all scheduled flight plans are removed from its flight plan queue
If a flight plan is not assigned to a specific UAV the flight plan scheduler shall automatically assign it to the next available UAV
When a flight plan is assigned to a specific UAV it shall be placed in the UAV s execution queue
When a flight route is scheduled for execution its waypoints takeoff altitude and identifier shall be used to instantiate a new flight plan
When requested by the user a currently executing mission plan shall be cancelled by removing all pending flight plans and removing all synchronization points

The FlightPattern for synchronized landing shall direct each UAV to synchronize at the final waypoint of the preceding route ascend or descend to a unique altitude synchronize fly to the longitude and latitude of the home coordinates synchronize and then descend to the landing altitude
When a UAV is executing flight plans and reaches a synchronization point it shall wait to proceed until all other UAVs sharing the same synchronization point have also reached this point
The flight plans of two or more UAVs shall be synchronized by inserting shared synchronization points between the ordered list of flight routes assigned to each participating UAV
Each individual UAV that is included in a MissionPlan shall have an ordered list of one or more flight routes assigned to it
If a UAV is in the air when a flight plan is assigned the takeoff altitude in the flight plan is ignored
When the takeoff command is issued the FlightSchedulingAndExecution checks for a pre specified altitude in the flight plan
If the computed distance from the UAV to the target waypoint is less than THRESHOLD WAYPOINT DISTANCE than the waypoint shall be considered reached
When the VehicleCore receives the UAV s current coordinates and if the UAV has an assigned target waypoint then the VehicleCore shall compute the current distance to the target waypoint
At the start of a flight plan the system shall send the first target waypoint to the UAV s GCS
When the hover in place command is rescinded the UAV s state is reverted to its previous state
If the UAV is in hover in place mode then no waypoints directives for that UAV shall be sent to the GCS
When the UAV is commanded to hover in place its state is changed to hover in place and a command is sent to the GCS

When the UAV is commanded to return to home the current flight plan shall be removed and a new flight plan shall be created containing only a single waypoint representing its original launch coordinates
Distances computed between two coordinates shall be accurate within meter over a distance of meters
When requested coordinates shall be transformed from p vectors to the default representation
When requested the CoordinateSystem shall be transform coordinates from the default representation to p vectors
When requested the CoordinateSystem shall transform coordinates transformed from the default representation to n vectors
The flight route xml format includes an optional takeoff altitude tag
When the UIMiddleware requests a flight route identified by its unique name the FlighRouteManager shall retrieve the associated file
When a flight route is uploaded to Dronology the FlightRouteManager shall save it under a unique name as an xml file
Flight routes shall be specified in the standard XML FlightRoute format
When a mode change message to USER CONTROLLED is received the Vehicle shall transition to USER CONTROLLED
When a UAV is executing flight plans and reaches a synchronization point which is followed by a delay task it shall wait to proceed until the delay specified in seconds is expired
Simple collision avoidance implementation that stops UAVs when they violate a minimum safety distance

Single UAV flight plan assignments taking an existing route instantiating it and assigning to a UAV
Provides capabilities for executing missions with multiple UAVs
Provides capabilities for executing flights assigned to a UAV
Provides basic flight related capabilities for UAVs

Provides capabilities for creating and managing flight routes within Dronology

The open street map component shall support multiple map providers
The MissionPlanner shall synchronize and coordinate the flights of multiple UAVs

The GCSMiddleware shall handle multiple GCS at the same time
When routes are assigned to a UAV a request shall be sent to the UIMiddleware to update the assignment in Dronology
The UI shall display the waypoints and their connections
All commands sent to and messages received from a CGC shall be logged to a dedicated GCS log file
The internal simulator provides low fidelity features for supporting quick initial tests of a virtual UAV Features include takeoff goto land and battery health
Position reckoning shall utilize the WGS reference system
Upon loading the UI requests all existing routes from the UIMiddleware Once the UIMiddleware respond to the request the UI displays all existing routes
Configuration parameters including map coordinates scale map style and color scheme shall be stored in a JSON Object on the server
The UAV location shall be updated on the map at the currently defined UI UAV REFRESH RATE
Unless otherwise configured in the configuration parameters the map shall be centered at White Field University of Notre Dame South Bend IN
When loading the map it shall be scaled as specified in the configuration
If no scale information is provided in the configuration the map shall display at a scale of MAP DEFAULT SCALE
The name state battery level speed and current coordinates of each UAV shall be displayed

Python based system that manages and controls UAVs Communicates with Dronology via the Ground Station middleware Each GCS is responsible for communicating directly with each UAV sending it commands and monitoring its state including its current position flight mode and health

Handles connections between Dronology and Ground Control Stations GCS Forwards commands monitoring and other messages from Dronology to its registered GCS and passes messages describing the state of the UAVs managed by each GCS back to dronology
A flight plan shall be unassigned from a UAV by removing it from the UAV s flight plan queue
By default the pending flight plansof a UAV s shall be serviced in FCFS order
If the flight plan queue is empty when the UAV reaches the final waypoint of its current flight plan then its state is set to IN AIR
Flight routes shall be created externally and uploaded to Dronology via the UI middleware
When a UAV is in FLYING state and has no currently executing flight plan it transitions to IN AIR
When a UAV in the TAKING OFF state achieves the target altitude it transitions to FLYING state
When permission is granted to UAV in the AWAITING TAKEOFF CLEARANCE state it transitions to TAKING OFF state
When a flight plan is assigned to a UAV in the ON GROUND state it transitions to the AWAITING TAKEOFF CLEARANCE state
Each UAV has zero or more pending flight plans
When a UAV is initially activated on the ground it is in the ON GROUND state
Altitude shall be specified in meters
All waypoints shall be specified using degrees longitude and latitude using Decimal Degrees format e g
A client may register with the UIMiddleware to receive notifications whenever unexpected events occur

A client shall register with the UIMiddleware to receive UAV type specification events whenever a new UAV type specification is created modified or deleted
A client shall register with the UIMiddleware to receive flight route event notifications whenever a flight route is created modified or deleted

To see if the haversine distance is an acceptable method for computing distance it should be compared to travel distance and laser distance travel distance is the distance a drone would actually have to travel to get there accounting for the shape of the Earth and assuming that changes in altitude would be gradual laser distance is the distance a laser beam would travel assuming line of sight So it would compute this distance even when a laser would need to travel through the Earth For example if point A was at the North Pole and point B was at the South Pole the laser distance would tell you the distance straight through the Earth

This function should take two wgs position one for the current position and another for the target position and the number of meters to travel it should return a new wgs position that is the specified distance away

Everyone should get to work with the position class that they are most comfortable with And to enable everyone to get the most out of the position classes distance functions should be provided to all classes That is what motivates this abstract base class The class should have these methods laser Distance that takes another WGS position returns a double travel distance that takes another WGS position returns a double toNvector returns an NVector toPVector returns a PVector toLlaCoordinate returns an LlaCoordinate toRotMatrix returns a matrix that can take displacement vectors from ECEF and rotate them into NED vectors

NvecInterpolator does position reckoning in WGS and a replacement simulator that uses it needs to be created Do movement simulator and battery simulator Replicate all base functionality of simple simulator

An N vector is a normal Vector that points out from the surface of the WGS reference ellipsoid The normal vector is combined with an altitude which represents the distance above or below the reference ellipsoid note this is the distance above sea level as sea level is defined as the surface of the ellipsoid in WGS The n vector and altitude together precisely define a position on Earth The n vector should be a unit vector i e a vector with a magnitude The altitude should be in meters Why we need this In dead reckoning calculations we need to take a position and add a velocity vector to it Drones often stay at constant elevations as they travel around the Earth This is a problem when using p vectors and velocity vectors The instantaneous velocity is tangent to the reference ellipsoid and thus follows the curvature of the Earth In aviation it is common to use n vectors because there is a nice formula that addresses this exact problem This also makes programming easier when considering edge cases like a drone flying east near the meridian where longitude degrees Using latitude and longitude for this calculation requires special logic to handle the transition to longitude degrees but no special logic is required when using n vectors N vectors also handle gracefully the poles where longitude is undefined For more information about n vectors see this article The following instance fields are needed in the nvector class x the x component of the n vector y the y component of the n vector z the z component of the n vector altitude the distance above sea level in meters The following methods are needed in the n vector class toLla takes no arguments and maps the n vector and altitude to a latitude longitude and altitude toPvec takes no arguments and maps the n vector and altitude to an X Y and Z coordinate in the WGS reference frame

We need an immutable class holding three doubles for X Y and Z in the WGS reference frame Here is some background information about the WGS reference frame The origin of this frame is at the center of mass of the Earth The X axis points towards where the equator meets the prime meridean latitude longitude The Z axis points towards the geographic north pole latitude longitude undefined The Y axis can be derived using right hand rule and points towards latitude longitude This class should have the following instance fields x the position along the X axis in meters y the position along the Y axis in meters z the position along the Z axis in meters This class should have the following methods toLla takes no arguments and returns the latitude longitude and altitude for this position toNvec takes no arguments and returns the n vector plus altitude for this position
